field_reports.description:
Greece experienced one of its most intense wildfire outbreaks in recent years, with over 50 wildfires reported in just 24 hours. The fires were fueled by a prolonged heatwave (temperatures reaching up to 45°C) and strong winds (6–7 Beaufort), creating extreme fire conditions across the country.

The primary affected areas were Kryoneri (Attica), Pedini - Ioannina (Epirus Region), Patra (Achaea Region), Temenia and surrounding villages (Chania, Crete), Polithea, Monastiri, and Aetos (Messinia, Peloponnese), Serres (Northern Greece), and Central and Northern Euboea (Evia).

Thousands of residents were evacuated across multiple regions. In numbers over 32,000 people were displaced nationwide, with many seeking shelter in schools, community centers, and temporary shelters.

Over 1,100 firefighters were deployed nationwide. Moreover, Greece requested six additional water-dropping aircraft from the EU Civil Protection Mechanism. One hundred forty-five firefighters, 44 vehicles, 7 helicopters, and 10 aircraft were active in Attica alone.

Many firefighters were hospitalized due to burns and smoke inhalation while battling the fires. These injuries occurred during intense efforts to contain fires threatening residential areas, with some fire trucks also damaged in the process. Moreover, civilians were injured, suffering from burns, respiratory problems, and other injuries.  

The extensive damage influences the forests, agricultural land, animal pens, houses, cars, and more.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Fire - 07-2025 - Wildfires in Greece, 26-28, July, 2025

field_reports.description:
Crete is currently experiencing a dramatic surge in migrant arrivals, with the situation reaching a critical point.

As of July 9, 2025, Crete has received over 3,500 migrants in the first nine days of July alone. Over 1,200 migrants arrived between July 1 and 3, primarily from Libya. An additional 2,000 migrants arrived in the 48 hours leading up to July 9, including 963 people on Monday, July 7.

This brings the total number of migrant arrivals in Crete for July 2025 (so far) to well over 3,500, with more expected in the coming days as boats continue to arrive daily.

Nearly 2,000 migrants have arrived on the island in just the past 48 hours. Since the beginning of 2025, over 9,000 migrants have arrived in Crete, representing a 350% increase compared to the same period last year. Boats carrying 50–100 people are arriving daily, often from Libya and Egypt, and Migrants come from diverse backgrounds, including Pakistan, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Egypt, and Yemen, as traffickers shift routes due to tighter surveillance in the Eastern Aegean. The recent rescue operation involved 520 individuals on a fishing vessel south of Gavdos.

Reception centers in Chania, Rethymno, and Heraklion are overcrowded and under-resourced. In Chania, migrants are housed at the Agia exhibition center, which is overcrowded and lacks necessities. In Rethymno, migrants are being sheltered at the commercial port under extreme heat conditions. In Heraklion, they have recently been transferred to an already full cargo terminal.

Local authorities are calling for urgent national intervention. Chania’s deputy mayor and regional governor have described the situation as “unmanageable”. Transfers to mainland Greece (e.g., Piraeus) have begun to relieve pressure on Crete. At the same time, the European Commission is under pressure to provide funding, logistics, and coordination, especially since Crete is a major tourist destination.

The Hellenic Coast Guard is conducting daily rescue operations, including one involving 520 people on a vessel south of Gavdos.

The authorities are attempting to strike a balance between humanitarian needs, local concerns, and the continuity of tourism.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Population Movement - 07-2025 - Population Movement Crete

field_reports.description:
Wildfires in Greece, June-July 2025 Report

Overview

Greece is currently battling severe wildfires, primarily affecting the islands of Chios and Crete, as well as areas near Athens, amid an intense heatwave with temperatures soaring above 42°C. The fires have prompted mass evacuations and emergency responses across the nation.

Experts cite rising temperatures and prolonged droughts as key drivers of increased wildfire frequency and intensity.  

Wildfires in Chios

Chios, one of Greece’s eastern Aegean islands, experienced a devastating wildfire outbreak starting on Sunday, June 22, 2025, which burned for several days across multiple fronts. The fires prompted mass evacuations, widespread damage, and a significant emergency response. The estimated burned area is 2,500 hectares (25 square kilometers) of forest, farmland, and low vegetation. During the operation, at least 16 villages were evacuated, including Agios Makarios, Vrontados, Chalkios, Dafnonas, and Lithi.

The Firefighting Force consisted of 444 firefighters, 85 vehicles, 14 aircraft and helicopters, and reinforcements from Athens, Thessaloniki, Kavala, and Lesvos.

The major fire fronts were in Kofinas, Chalkios, Agios Makarios: Initial outbreak zones with rapid spread due to strong winds, and Agios Georgios to Vessa-Lithi: Largest active front, with flare-ups continuing into late June. In Lithi, Fire reached coastal settlements, damaging homes and mastic crops.

The impact was related to environmental factors, as there was a significant loss of forest and farmland; however, mastic crops—a key local product—suffered only minor damage overall. In infrastructure, there are power outages in northern Chios, especially around Vrontados. In tourism, as Hotels evacuated in coastal areas like Lithi.
As of June 25, the fire was nearing extinction, with only minor flare-ups remaining. Authorities remain vigilant due to high temperatures and wind conditions.

Wildfires in Crete (Ierapetra region)


The wildfire near Ierapetra, Crete, started on the afternoon of Wednesday, July 2, 2025. By the evening, the fire had already reached multiple fronts and forced mass evacuations from villages and tourist resorts along the southeastern coast of Crete. The fire, which began near Ierapetra, has split into three active fronts: Achlia, Ferma, and Skinokapsala.

The operation involved 230 firefighters, 10 helicopters, and 46 vehicles. The gale-force winds (up to 80 km/h) and rugged terrain are complicating containment efforts. Drones and water bombers were used during the day; aerial firefighting was limited at night. Sea evacuations were prepared with the assistance of six private boats and the Coast Guard. The key affected areas were: Ferma, Katharades, Koutsounari, Kakia Skala, Achlia, Skinokapsala. 
Several evacuation operations were conducted, involving both tourists and residents. The evacuations were carried out from hotels, homes, and beach resorts. People were sheltered in an indoor sports arena and relocated to hotels in safer areas. Several Homes, greenhouses, and rental properties were destroyed, as the fires reached beachfront areas, with dramatic scenes of smoke plumes over the sea. Additionally, power outages and mobile signal disruptions occurred in the affected zones. 

Wildfires in Attica

The fire broke out in Rafina-Pikermi, on Thursday, July 3, 2025, a coastal town in eastern Attica, near Athens. Originated near Marathonos Avenue and Arionos Street, close to the village of Pikermi.
There were evacuations for the areas of Agia Kyriaki, Etos Steko, and Imeros Pefkos. The residents and tourists were directed to evacuate toward the Artemida sports stadium.

The winds were 5–6 Beaufort (30–50 km/h), which caused the fire to jump across Marathonos Avenue. Dense pine forests, olive groves, and vineyards fueled the fire. The smoke was heavy, blanketing the area and even affecting visibility at Athens International Airport, which was temporarily closed on one of its runways.
The operation included 90 firefighters, 6 ground teams, 15 fire engines, 2 aircraft, and 3 helicopters.
Several homes were burned, and the roads were closed on Marathonos Avenue and the surrounding areas.

Another wildfire broke out on July 9, 2025, in Asprochori, located in the Municipality of Oropos, north of Athens. The fire ignited in an agricultural-forest area and quickly spread due to dry conditions, threatening nearby residential zones. 
In the area, over 60 firefighters, 20 vehicles, and 3 ground teams were deployed; additionally, 13 firefighting aircraft and 6 helicopters were also mobilized. Local municipalities contributed with construction machinery and water tankers.
This fire is part of a broader wave of wildfires across Greece, with over 55 fires reported in the last 24 hours due to drought and high winds.
While no official evacuation numbers have been released, the proximity of the fire to homes suggests that precautionary evacuations may have occurred. The roads, such as Agiou Konstantinou Street and parts of the Athens–Lamia National Highway, have been closed or rerouted.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Fire - 06-2025 - Wildfires in Greece, June-July 2025 Report

results.name: GRC: Fire - 06-2025 - Wildfires in Greece, June-July 2025 Report

field_reports.affected_pop_centres: Amorgos, Santorini:Ammoudi, Armeni, Old post Thiron. Ios, Anafi.
field_reports.description:
Intense seismic activity has recently been observed in the Cyclades, specifically in the sea area of Anydros, between Santorini and Amorgos, which has concerned residents and the country's government.
More than 1.000 earthquakes, with a maximum magnitude of 5.3 on the Richter scale, have been recorded in the last few days between Santorini and Amorgos in the area of Anydros. The seismic sequence has continued to increase over the previous few days. The current seismic activity is due to submarine faults in an NE-SW direction and is unrelated to volcanic activity.
The Greek government has taken precautionary measures for the safety of citizens on the islands of Santorini, Amorgos, Anafi, and Ios. 
The Committees recommend avoiding gatherings in enclosed areas, avoiding approaching abandoned buildings, avoiding access to ports: Ammoudiou, Armeni, Korfu, Old Port of Fira, to proceed to the removal of dangerous elements of non-structural vulnerability in their buildings and the emptying of water in swimming pools (swimming pools), to choose safe routes when moving through the urban fabric and the provincial road network, particularly in areas with steep slopes where landslides are likely to occur and where there is a direct route away from coastal areas in the event of strong earthquakes.
Moreover, messages via 112 was sent to the residents of Santorini, warning them of the risk of landslides due to earthquake activity and noting that access to the areas of Ammoudi, Armenia, and the Old Port of Fira in Thira is prohibited.
In addition, schools in Thira, Anafi, Ios, Paros, and Amorgos will remain closed until Friday, 14/02/2025.
As a precautionary measure, a team of the 1st Special Disaster Response Unit (EMAK) from the Fire Department, rescue dogs, two teams of the 1st Special Forestry Operations Unit, a team of drone operators and aerial rescuers have gone to the island of Santorini.
At the same time, many residents have left the islands and are hosting relatives on the mainland. 
Historical Review
Historically, the island of Santorini has been hit by a 7.5 magnitude earthquake in 1956. 
It was 9 July 1956, at 5:11 am, when the devastating earthquake struck. The epicenter was south of the island of Amorgos (the easternmost island of the Cyclades) in the Aegean Sea. 
The 7.5 on the Richter scale left 53 people dead and over 100 injured, causing the volcano of Thera to erupt, which almost flattened Santorini and caused a massive tidal wave - a tsunami. 
Still, it has been listed as the biggest earthquake of the 20th century across Europe, from the Urals to Gibraltar and from Malta to Lapland. 
The work on the main earthquake was completed by the devastating aftershock 13 minutes after magnitude 7.2.

results.name: GRC: Earthquake - 02-2025 - Ιntense earthquake activity
results.summary:
Intense seismic activity has been observed in recent days in the Cyclades, specifically in the sea area of Anydros, between Thira and Amorgos, which has concerned residents and the country's government.
More than 200 earthquakes (with a maximum magnitude of 4.5) have been recorded in the last few days in the area of Anudros, between Thera and Amorgos. The seismic sequence has continued to increase over the last 48 hours. The current seismic activity on the island of Andros is due to submarine faults in an NE-SW direction and is unrelated to volcanic activity.
The Greek government has taken precautionary measures for the safety of citizens on the islands of Santorini, Amorgos, Anafi, and Ios.
The Committees recommend avoiding gatherings in enclosed areas, avoiding approaching abandoned buildings, avoiding access to ports: Ammoudiou, Armeni, Korfu, Old Port of Fira, to proceed to the removal of dangerous elements of non-structural vulnerability in their buildings and the emptying of water in swimming pools (swimming pools), to choose safe routes when moving through the urban fabric and the provincial road network, particularly in areas with steep slopes where landslides are likely to occur and where there is a direct route away from coastal areas in the event of strong earthquakes.
Still on the island of Santorini, a team of the 1st EMAK with a rescue dog and two teams of the 1st Special Forestry Operations Unit, as well as a team of drone operators and aerial rescuers, have gone to the island of Santorini as a precautionary measure.
Also, schools in Thira, Anafi, Ios, Paros, and Amorgos will remain closed until Friday, 07/02/2025.
A message via 112 was sent to the residents of Santorini, warning them of the risk of landslides due to earthquake activity and noting that access to the areas of Ammoudi, Armenia, and the Old Port of Fira in Thira is prohibited.
For now, the largest earthquake recorded is 4.6 magnitude between Santorini and Amorgos. 
Historically, the island of Santorini has been hit by a 7.5 magnitude earthquake in 1956. 
It was 9 July 1956, at 5:11 am, when the devastating earthquake struck. The epicenter was south of the island of Amorgos (the easternmost island of the Cyclades) in the Aegean Sea. 
The 7.5 on the Richter scale left 53 people dead and over 100 injured, causing the volcano of Thera to erupt, which almost flattened Santorini and caused a massive tidal wave - a tsunami. 
Still, it has been listed as the biggest earthquake of the 20th century across Europe, from the Urals to Gibraltar and from Malta to Lapland. 
The work on the main earthquake was completed by the devastating aftershock 13 minutes after magnitude 7.2.

field_reports.description:
On Sunday, 11 August, a wildfire broke out at 3 p.m. and quickly reached the village of Varnavas, 35 km (20 miles) north of Athens, Attica, Greece. Due to the windy weather, the fire spread out very quickly.
 
Evacuation orders were issued for more than a dozen areas near Varnavas, including Marathon and several Athens suburbs, causing residents to flee their homes. In addition, a children's hospital, a military hospital, and two monasteries were evacuated early Monday. At the same time, three Athens hospitals were put on heightened alert to treat any potential injuries.
 
As a result, burned trees, houses, cars, and smoke clouds covered Athens, the Greek capital. 
The number of houses, cars, forest and agricultural land, livestock units, and all kinds of businesses that have been burned remains unknown.

Approximately 700 firefighters, backed by 27 teams specially trained to tackle wildfires and including more than 80 members of the armed forces, were battling the flames. More than 180 vehicles were deployed, while more than 30 water-dropping planes and helicopters provided aerial support.

Even if the situation is currently under control, the area is still on alert.

results.name: GRC: Fire - 08-2024 - ATTICA WILDFIRE

field_reports.description: Friday February 09, early in the morning, a pasing by ship noticed a sinking ship in north side of Crete, close to Agia Galini, Rethymno, Crete. Immediately they alerted port authorities and assisted the transportation of the 57 people (all men) to the island. Curently they accomodated in a temporary shelter in the city of Rethymno, Crete.

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 02-2024 - Rethymno, Crete
results.summary: Friday February 09, early in the morning, a pasing by ship noticed a sinking ship in north side of Crete, close to Agia Galini, Rethymno, Crete. Immediately they alerted port authorities and assisted the transportation of the 57 people (all men) to the island. Curently they accomodated in a temporary shelter in the city of Rethymno, Crete.

field_reports.description: 74 refugees in cluding 20 minors and 1 8 years old girl, were located in the island of Gaudos, Chania, Crete in the end of January. Due to weather conditions they were trapped till Friday 02 february, when local authorities managed to transfer them safe to Chania, Kalathas children camp.

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 02-2024 - Chania, Crete
results.summary: 74 refugees in cluding 20 minors and 1 8 years old girl, were located in the island of Gaudos, Chania, Crete in the end of January. Due to weather conditions they were trapped till Friday 02 february, when local authorities managed to transfer them safe to Chania, Kalathas children camp.

field_reports.description:
42 refugees, of which 32 Egyptians and 10 Bangladeshis were detected in the early morning, Saturday 01/20/2024, close to Kaloi Limenes bay, southerly Crete. A cargo ship noticed a distress signal from the boat in which they were traveling. The cargo ship in collaboration with the local civil protection team,  transported them to the bay of Kali Limenes, from where the Coast Guard began an operation to transport them first to a shelter and after to Heraklion in order to temporarily accommodate them. Among the migrants, who are all men, there are also 4 minors.

There were more arrivals, as in the early Sunday morning , January 21, 34 refugees reached Kaloi Limenes bay and in the evening 73 more, including 5 minors.

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 01-2024 - Moires, Crete
results.summary: 42 migrants, of which 32 Egyptians and 10 Bangladeshis were detected in the early morning, Saturday 01/20/2023, close to Kali Limenes bay, southerly Crete. A cargo ship noticed a distress signal from the boat in which they were traveling. The cargo ship in collaboration with the local civil protection team,  transported them to the bay of Kali Limenes, from where the Coast Guard began an operation to transport them first to a shelter and after to Heraklion in order to temporarily accommodate them. Among the migrants, who are all men, there are also 4 minors.

field_reports.description: On Saturday 13 of January, 2024, a boat carrying 117 refugees and immigrants was spotted in the early morning in the Kaloi Limenes cove of the municipality of Phaistos, Heraklion, Crete. Among the migrants, there are 2 women and 28 minors. At this time, the operation of transporting them to the city of Heraklion is underway, accompanied by port authorities and Hellenic Red Cross. People sufer monor injures, according to the information so far.

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 01-2024 - Heraklion, Crete
results.summary: On Saturday 13 of January, 2024, a boat carrying 117 refugees and immigrants was spotted in the early morning in the Kaloi Limenes cove of the municipality of Phaistos, Heraklion, Crete. Among the migrants, there are 2 women and 28 minors. At this time, the operation of transporting them to the city of Heraklion is underway, accompanied by port authorities and Hellenic Red Cross. People sufer monor injures, according to the information so far.

field_reports.description:
29 people (2 of them minors) were located Saturday morning 30/12/2023, in Agia Galini of Rethymno by the Hellenic Authorities.

They started their journey in a boat,  from a beach near the "Kambut" region of Libya. After being rounded up, were safely transported to the port of Agia Galini and from there in a temporary accommodation facility of the Municipality of Rethymno and eventually in Pireus, Attica.

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 12-2023 - Rethymno, Dec 2023
results.summary:
29 people (2 of them minors) were located Saturday morning 30/12/2023, in Agia Galini of Rethymno by the Hellenic Authorities.

They started their journey in a boat,  from a beach near the "Kambut" region of Libya. After being rounded up, were safely transported to the port of Agia Galini and from there in a temporary accommodation facility of the Municipality of Rethymno and eventually in Pireus, Attica.

field_reports.description:
The recent flood disaster of Volos-Karditsa and Larissa is a result of heavy and prolonged rainfall in a region prone to flooding. The rainfall has exceeded normal levels, leading to the overflow of rivers and the inundation of low-lying areas. This flood disaster can be classified as a riverine flood. It's Immediate Impacts are as listed:

a. Property Damage: The floodwaters damaged homes, buildings, and infrastructure, leading to significant financial losses.

b. Evacuations: Local authorities issued evacuation orders to ensure the safety of residents in affected areas (emergency number 112)

c. Loss of Life: Unfortunately, the flood resulted in casualties with many missing citizens (search and rescue ongoing)

d. Disruption of Services: disrupted essential services such as transportation, electricity, and clean water supply.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Flood - 2023-09 - VOLOS- KARDITSA- LARISSA FLOODS

results.name: GRC: Flood - 2023-09 - VOLOS- KARDITSA- LARISSA FLOODS

field_reports.description: Thursday, August 31 2023. After one in the morning, at the port of Kalamata arrived seventysix migrants who were rescued 64 n.m. Southwest of Zakynthos island. The people were on board on a sailing vessel which was in danger and were picked up by an Egyptian-flagged cargo ship. They were transported to Kalamata, Peloponese where they will be registered and temporarily accommodated until they will be able to moved to an organized accommodation structure in the country.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Population Movement - 2023-08 - Population Movement, Kalamata

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 2023-08 - Population Movement, Kalamata
results.summary: Thursday, August 31 2023. After one in the morning, at the port of Kalamata arrived seventysix migrants who were rescued 64 n.m. Southwest of Zakynthos island. The people were on board on a sailing vessel which was in danger and were picked up by an Egyptian-flagged cargo ship. They were transported to Kalamata, Peloponese where they will be registered and temporarily accommodated until they will be able to moved to an organized accommodation structure in the country.

field_reports.description: In the port of Kalamata, a total of 21 migrants, who were spotted on Wednesday, August 23, afternoon by the Coast Guard, in a 70 nm boat  west of Pylos, Kalamata, Peloponnese disembarked and are being accommodated since this morning, Thursday, August 24, 2023.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Population Movement - 2023-08 - Population Movement Pylos, Peloponnese

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 2023-08 - Population Movement Pylos, Peloponnese
results.summary: In the port of Kalamata, a total of 21 migrants, who were spotted on Wednesday, August 23, afternoon by the Coast Guard, in a 70 nm boat  west of Pylos, Kalamata, Peloponnese disembarked and are being accommodated since this morning, Thursday, August 24, 2023.

field_reports.description:
Friday evening 18/08/2023, a wildfire broke out at the island of Zakynthos close to Akrotiri area. Due to the strong winds the fire continue southeast. Νo houses had any damages, in contrast with many hectares which burned down. Τhe intervention of the Fire Department and the local authorities was immediate, thus the fire went under control after some hours.

 Saturday 19/08/2023 , a forest fire broke out early Saturday near the village of Melia, near the town of Alexandroupoli, in northeastern Greece. Eight villages were evacuated and the authorities closed down the major higway, in both directions, to protect the civilians fom the heavy smoke. At the moment,  more than 130 firefighters, assisted by 14 water-dropping planes and three helicopters, were struggling to contain the blaze and reinforcements were being sent from other parts of the country. Many hectares were burned and some houses suffered damages. According to official information 19 suspected asylum seekers, in Dandia area, lost their life.

Monday, 21/08/2023, a wildfire broke out at the village of Prodromos, Voiotia. Very quickly and due to the strings winds the fire expanded to the nearby area Sarandi. One dead of a Shepard was been reported. Some houses suffered damages and the local camping burned to the ground. 

Monday, 21/08/2023, a wildfire broke out at the area of Psatha, Euboea. Fortunate the fire went under control. 

Tuesday, 22/08/203, Aspropyrgos, Attica a fire was reported close to the industrial area. Situation is crusial due to the businesses which are in that territory.

results.name: GRC: Fire - 2013-08 - Wildfires Greece August 2023
results.summary: Friday evening 18/08/2023, a wildfire broke out at the island of Zakynthos close to Akrotiri area. Due to the strong winds the fire continue southeast. Νo houses had any damages, in contrast with many hectares which burned down. Τhe intervention of the Fire Department and the local authorities was immediate, thus the fire went under control after some hours.

field_reports.description: Sunday, August 13, 2023, Samaria Gorge, Chania, Crete. The region was rattled by a magnitude 4.9 quake, the temblor triggered the evacuation of more than 600 people along the 16-kilometer (10-mile) Samaria hiking trail. A 45-year-old Spanish hiker was transported by helicopter to a state hospital in the port city of Chania, where he remained in critical condition after part of his right leg was amputated.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Earthquake - 2023-08 - Earthquake Samaria Gorge, Crete

results.name: GRC: Earthquake - 2023-08 - Earthquake Samaria Gorge, Crete
results.summary: Sunday, August 13, 2023, Samaria Gorge, Chania, Crete. The region was rattled by a magnitude 4.9 quake, the temblor triggered the evacuation of more than 600 people along the 16-kilometer (10-mile) Samaria hiking trail. A 45-year-old Spanish hiker was transported by helicopter to a state hospital in the port city of Chania, where he remained in critical condition after part of his right leg was amputated.

field_reports.description:
The last days many wildfires hitting several areas in Greece, Firefighters are working on 90 fire fronts across the state. According to the infromation it is expected to be the warmest July on record in more than 50 years. Due to high temperatures and the strong winds most of the fires aren't under control. The wilfire in Euboea in the municipality of Karystos, cost the life of two pilots of a Canadair-style water bomber during their effort to put out the fire, and the life of a cattle breeder, also in mountainous Euboea. In the wilfire that broke out in Magnisia, Volos July 26, an eledry woman was found charred inside a mobile home, also a shepherd lost his life during his effort to save his flock. Thousand of hectares, hundred of houses, hotels, cars, factories, businesses and animals were burned. Overall, more than 35.000 thousand residents and tourists were forced to evacuate.

Attica: July 17, a wildfire broke out in east Attica, Kouvaras. The fire very quickly expanded to other nearby areas, Anavyssos, Saronida and Lagonisi. More than 30.000 hectares and several houses were burned. Eight areas were forced to evacuate. Also, due to the large fire, the Police has proceeded to stop the traffic of vehicles in nearby areas.

Rhodes: July 18, a wildfire borke out on the island of Rhodes, south aegean Greece, at Emponas area. Today is the ninth day after the fire started and are three active fronts. Around 260 firefighters, 42 fire trucks, 4 helicopters and 3 planes, hundreds of volunteers, the Greek army and the coast guard battle the blaze burning and support the evacution and other procedures. More assistant was requested. At the moment there are thousands of burned lands, houses, hotels and animals. Twelve areas were evacuated by the sea and by land. In the beggining, there are several shelters to accommodate the fire victims. Fire is not yet under control. At the moment, firefighting forces are focusing on the villages of Vati, Asklipieio and Archangelosthe. The island is in a state of Emergency. 

Eboea: July 23, a wildfires broke out in Eboea, Karystos. The fire started on three different fronts and immediately took on large proportions. At present, the situation in Karystos shows improvement, with firefighters successfully tackling scattered outbreaks. The fire has burned houses, many livestock facilities and animals. Residents and tourists of 6 areas were forced to evacuate. At the area 93 firefighters with 3 groups of pedestrians and 32 vehicles are operating at the scene, while from the air 3 is assistance from helicopters and aircraft as well as earthmoving machines and water carriers of the local municipality. 

Corfu: July 23, a wildfire broke out in northeast Corfu, burning forest and grassland areas with two big fronts which are located in the northeastern part of the island. The first goes from the village of Palia Perithia to Lavki and the second near Imerolia. Around 60 firefighters with 21 water trucks and three groups of firefighters on foot are operating, assisted by two helicopters and two PZL airplanes. Regarding the burned hectares, the estimation is around 20.000. More than 12 settlements were forced evacuation. After three days, seems that the fire is under control. 

Magnisia: July 26, a wilfire broke out in Velestino, Volos, Magnisia. At present, are two active fronts. Six areas were forced evacuation. While in the territory there are electricity issues due to the fire. Strong ground forces and air forces are working to extinguish the fire.

Other: July 17, a wildfire broke out about 30 kilometers northwest of Athens, in Dervenochoria, which by July 21 had burned an area of ​​more than 100,000 hectares and damaged many houses

July 23, a wildfire broke out in Aigio, Peloponnisos. With many scattered outbreaks of fire in an area which is inaccessible and very difficult for the intervention of ground forces. 

July 26, Large fronts broke out Lamia, Central Greece, which areas were being evacuated.

contacts.name: STELLA KATSOULOPOULOU
contacts.title: Head of Admin in Samaritans Division

field_reports.description: Hellenic Red Cross has immediately responded to the call of the Minister of Culture, Mrs Lina Mendoni , for providing assistance to thousands of visitors to the Acropolis place. In particular for three days, Staff and volunteers of  HRC distributed about 20,000 water bottles per day, to the visitors of Acropolis museum while at the same time  instructions for high temperature periods were communicated through leaflets of the Communications Department  under extremely difficult situations due to the high temperatures associated.

results.name: GRC: Heat Wave - 2023-07 - Heat Wave "KLEON"
results.summary: Hellenic Red Cross has immediately responded to the call of the Minister of Culture, Mrs Lina Mendoni , for providing assistance to thousands of visitors to the Acropolis place. In particular for three days, Staff and volunteers of  HRC distributed about 20,000 water bottles per day, to the visitors of Acropolis museum while at the same time  instructions for high temperature periods were communicated through leaflets of the Communications Department  under extremely difficult situations due to the high temperatures associated.

field_reports.description:
On Wednesday 21 June 2023 a sailing boat arrived to the port of Kalamata  in southern Greece carrying 64 migrants on board. All arrived safely and are being proccessed at the port.

The Hellenic Red Cross was mobilized immediately in light of the emergency situation that arosed in Kalamata, to provide support to the people in need.

The staff and volunteers of the Health Sector of the Regional Department of Kalamata of the Hellenic Red Cross offered First Aid and basic necessities to the migrants while providing them with the necessary medicines and medical equipment.

The volunteers of the Hellenic Red Cross will stay by their side as long as necessary.

The nationalites of the people is as follows: 55 people from Iraq, 7 from Iran, 2 from Morocco.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Population Movement - 2023-06 - Migrant boat arrival in Kalamata

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 2023-06 - Migrant boat arrival in Kalamata
results.summary:

field_reports.description:
Early on Wednesday 14 June a fishing boat capsized in international waters 47 nautical miles southwest of Pylos in southern Greece, in one of the deepest areas in the Mediterranean. The bodies of dozens of individuals have been recovered with hundreds feared missing as reports suggest that 400-750 people were onboard.  104 individuals were rescued -none of whom were wearing a life jacket- however, as the time passes hopes of finding survivors are diminishing. This is the deadliest shipwreck off Greece in several years.

The boat had sailed from the Libyan town of Tobruk, which lies south of the Greek island of Crete, with most on board being young men in their 20s. Coast guard said the boat, which was en route to Italy, was spotted in international waters late on Tuesday 13 June by an aircraft belonging to EU border agency Frontex and two nearby vessels. It said those on board had refused assistance offered by Greek authorities late on Tuesday. A few hours later the boat capsized and sank, triggering a massive search-and-rescue operation mounted by the Hellenic Coast Guard.

Four rescued migrants were rushed to Kalamata hospital in a Super-Puma helicopter while the other rescued individuals were taken to the port of Kalamata, where preparations for their reception have been made with the assistance of the general secretariat of Civil Protection.

The Hellenic Red Cross, with the specialized nursing staff and the volunteers of the Health Sector of the Kalamata Regional Department assisted from the first moment the survivors of the wreck. Volunteer Samaritans-Rescuers of the HRC were also deployed and supported more than 80 migrants (including 20 children), providing first aid and distributing food and basic necessities while offering psychological support to the rescued migrants. The main health problems faced are secondary drowning, shortness of breath, dehydration, asthma attacks, high fever, exhaustion, dysuria, hematuria, and otitis. 

Staff of the Research & Restoring Family Links (RFL) Sector of the HRC arrived today in Kalamata, in order to coordinate from the spot the actions for the search for the missing people and the restoration of the family ties of the survivors, with the support of the ICRC team in Greece. 

The HRC will remain at the scene for as long as necessary.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Population Movement - 2023-06 - Greece - Peloponnese Shipwreck

field_reports.description: On Tuesday evening at 23:00, local time, a passenger train and a cargo train were involved in the fatal head-on crash at Tempi near the city of Larissa in Central Greece, resulting in the loss of at least 38 lives and more than 85 people injured. After the collision a fire erraptued at the first wagons of the train. The ones that were hospitalized had serious injuries. Passengers with minor injuries were transferred by bus to Thessaloniki.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Transport Accident - 2023-02 - Fatal Train Collision

results.name: GRC: Transport Accident - 2023-02 - Fatal Train Collision
results.summary: On Tuesday evening at 23:00, local time, a passenger train and a cargo train were involved in the fatal head-on crash at Tempi near the city of Larissa in Central Greece, resulting in the loss of at least 38 lives and more than 85 people injured. After the collision a fire erraptued at the first wagons of the train. The ones that were hospitalized had serious injuries. Passengers with minor injuries were transferred by bus to Thessaloniki.

field_reports.description:
Οn Tuesday afternoon a fishing boat, in which were on board about 400 to 500 people, was rescued during gale-force winds, and docked at Palaiochora, Crete. A Greek navy frigate, two cargo ships, a tanker, two Italian fishing boats and Hellenic Red Cross rescuers were dispatched to assist the vessel that was adrift in winds of over 30 kilometres (19 miles) an hour. There are no missing people. 
 
0 of 30 seconds, Volumn Tuesday after the fishing boat they were travelling on issued a distress signal off the island of Crete, the coast guard said. A spokesperson for the coast guard cited survivors as saying about 400 to 500 people were on board. Two cargo ships, one navy frigate and one tanker assisted in the rescue, which was hindered by near gale force winds in the area.
field_reports.summary: GRC: Population Movement - 2022-11 - Rescue operation after Migrant Boat issues

results.name: GRC: Population Movement - 2022-11 - Rescue operation after Migrant Boat issues

field_reports.description: Torrential rainfalls hit the island of Crete on Saturday morning. Homes and businesses have been flooded, streets turned into mud rivers, vehicles have been swept away, bars, restaurants and supermarkets landed in the sea, Agia Pelagia, surrounding areas and Kartetos was hit after 11 o’ clock in the morning.

results.name: GRC: Flood - 2022-10 - Flood-Heraklion, Crete
results.summary: Torrential rainfalls hit the island of Crete on Saturday morning. Homes and businesses have been flooded, streets turned into mud rivers, vehicles have been swept away, bars, restaurants and supermarkets landed in the sea, Agia Pelagia, surrounding areas and Kartetos was hit after 11 o’ clock in the morning.

field_reports.description:
-A fire broke out on Friday 15 of July, in a semi-mountainous area in the municipality of Agios Vasilios, between the villages Orne and Krya Vrysi, in Rethymno, Crete. Six villages had been evacuated as a precaution as the flames came within 80 metres of its perimeter. Strong winds were pushing the flames through agricultural land toward the central road leading from Rethymno to Agia Galini.
Fire fronts are still active. 
-On Tuesday 19 of July 2022 another fire broke out in the wider area of Penteli, Attica. Due to stronges winds blowing thta day, the fire went out of control from the first hours. Thousand of people were forced to flee. 
In the meantime, one more fire raged near the city of Megara, 40 km west of Athens, again authorities order evacuation.
-Thursdasy 21 of July o wildfire broke out at the forest at Dadia–Lefkimi–Soufli Forest National Park in Evros (Greece's biggest Natura 2000 site). The fire has already destroyed nearly 500 hectares (1,220 acres) of woodland.
-Saturday 23 of July a fire broke out at Vatera and Vrisa, Lesvos causing the evacuation of hundreds of tourists and residents from the beachside of the village.

A wildfire broke out on Saturday 04 of June in the territory of Glyfada, in the Attica Region of Greece. Due to strong winds, the fire spread quickly towards the wider area of Voula and Vari.  For safety reasons all affected areas were evacuated. Approximately 4.500 acres and undergrowth were burned, also 23 houses, 4 cars, 1 motorcycle were tottaly burned and many other with serious damages. Firefighters, Firetrucks, Helicopters and others were mobilized to confront the situation.

From Saturday 22nd of January the weather condition in Greece changed to very low temperatures. As from Monday 24th of January, unusually heavy snowfall has already blanketed the northern suburbs of Athens and several roads are passable only with snow chains. The lowest temperature was -5 degrees. Thousands of cars were left standed around Attika due to the heavy snowfall. Almost 1.800 cars remained stuck and around 500 drivers remained overnight on the Attiki odos motorway.  
Because of many trees who fell on the cables and also on the roads and the cars, the transportation stopped for several hours and in more than 25 areas electricity was cut, thus many people remained without heating. 
Due to the extremely difficult conditions, Tuesday and Wednesday was declared public holiday (except grocery stores, gas stations and pharmacies) for seven regions of Greece. 
In the central Greece, fifteen passengers were injured when a rail transport vehicle tried to pull a train carrying about 200 passengers which had halted in heavy snow.

In the early morning of Sunday 31 of October 2021, a cargo ship disembarked at the port of the Kos island , with 375 migrants on board. Migrants were transferred to the local Reception and Identification Migrant Center. The majority are from Afghanistan and Pakistan.

The island of Crete was shaken by a quake of magnitude 5.8. Till today hundreds of aftershocks were recorded. The 80% of the villages in municipality of Minoa Pediados, Heraklion, Crete were affected. Fifty-six engineers are at the area recording the damages in houses, schools, health centers and others. Most of the buildings were damaged and many were collapsed. Currently more than 1.000 building are declared uninhabitable. Citizens were order to stay away from the damaged buildings due to the risk of collapse, till today are hosting in tents or in relative's houses. The Hellenic Red Cross supports the government's effort from the first day of the disaster, with teams remaining at the point of interest 24hours daily.

results.name: GDACS Orange: Greece WF Green impact for forestfire in 43725 ha
results.summary: On 06/08/2021, a forest fire started in Greece,  until 07/08/2021.

field_reports.description: A wildfire started on Monday 16 of August, in the area of Vilia west of Athens. The blaze is moving fast and as the fire front is huge, extending a distance of 20 kilometers and more. Till now 96.000 acres were burned and more than 10 houses totally destroyed. In addition, 10 cities with population of 5.140people, were order evacuation. A power of 461 firefighters, 9 ground teams, 166 fire vechicles, 7 aircrafts and 7 helicopters, many water vehicles, volunteers and as also HRC were mobilized. Situation is still not under control.

Varympompi:On Tuesday 03/08/2021 under unknown circumstances a wildfire broke out in the area of Varympompi, Attica. In few hours fire spread in the areas of Thrakomakedones, Krioneri, Drosopigi, Afidnes etc. At the moment, situation is stable but still on alert. More than 520 firefighters, 17 ground teams, 150 Vehicles, 5 aircrafts, 4 helicopters, a lot of water vehicles and volunteers were mobilized. Many houses, cars, businesses and other infrastructures were damaged. More than 300 houses and 30.000 acres were burned. Also numerous of areas were avacuated. 
Evia:At the same day another wildfire broke out. This time in the area of northern Evia. Till today the wider territory is under emergency. The estimation about the damaged acres is approximatelly 600.000 and more than 1.000 houses were burned. A power of 873 firefighters, 50 ground teams and 229 vehicles are in the area. 
Ilia:A day after on Wednesday 04/08/2021 another wildfire broke out in the area of Ilia. Fire is spreading fastly in other areas. The current damage is 120.000 acres and many other damages. 350 firefighters, 10 ground teams and 118 vehicles are undertaken the fire event. In all 3 areas more than 40.000 people were forced to evacuate their houses.  Keratea: Another wildfire broke out today Monday 16 of August. It started around 11:00 o’clock in the Keratea region southeast of Athens. Very quickly spread in the wider territory and heading towards the national park of Sounio. Many communities evacuated. According to the latest information the fire is under control.
Vilia: The wildfire started on Monday 16 of August, in the area of Vilia west of Athens. The blaze is moving fast and as the fire front is huge, extending a distance of 20 kilometers and more, situation is still not under control. Till now 80.000 acres were burned, as many houses. In addition than 10 villages were order evacuation. A power of 427 firefighters, 9 ground teams, 149 fire vechicles, 7 aircrafts and 7 helicopters as also many water vehicles and volunteers were mobilized.
field_reports.summary: Wildfires: Varympompi, Ilia, Evia, Keratea, Vilia

field_reports.description: On July 27 2021, a wildfire broke out in the forest area at Stamata, in the Attica Region of Greece. Due to strong winds blowing that day, the fire spread quickly towards the wider area, reaching residential communities and threating properties. Approximately more than 2,500 residencies have been evacuated, more than 25 houses were burned, and 15 cars were destroyed. At the area were mobilized 310 Firefighters, 110 Firetrucks, 12 Helicopters and 9 aircrafts. A day after on July 28 2021, another fire broke out in the forest area at villages Elekistra, Karya and Neo Souli in northwest Peloponese Region of Greece. More than 15 houses and 3.000 acres of forest area have been burned. At the area were mobilized 294 Firefighters, 77 Firetrucks, 12 Helicopters, 9 aircrafts. Another fire broke out on July 31 in the areas of Psathopyrgos Lampiri, Kamares and Ziria in the Rodhes Island. Also in this fire, the response of the fire department was extensive. It is worth mentioned that in the first semester of 2021 the total number of agroforestry fires have been increased 20.1% compared to 2020. In the first seven months of 2021, a total of 162,132 acres of agroforestry were burned, a percentage of 49.3% increased, compared to 2020.

On May 19, 2021, at 22:00 (local time), a wildfire broke out in the forest area at Sxino Korinthias in the Peloponese Region of Greece. Due to strong winds blowing that day, the fire spread quickly towards the wider area, reaching residential communities and threating properties. Approximately more than 1,500 residencies have been evacuated 40,000 acres of forest area have been burned. The Civil Protection Authority ordered the pre-emptive evacuation of the residential community of Sxinos, Agia Sotira, Vamvakies, Mavrolimni, and neighboring areas.

The strong earthquake that occurred at noon (03/03/21), in the greater area of Elassona (Thessaly - Central Greece), resulted to many houses' damages (eg schools) and disasters, especially for 3 villages that they were in the center of the storm.

results.name: GDACS Orange: Albania, Bulgaria, Greece, Lebanon, The Republic of North Macedonia, Syria, Turkey ...
results.summary: The  Drought alert level is Green.

results.name: GDACS Red: Greece EQ Magnitude 7M, Depth:10km
results.summary: On 10/30/2020 11:51:26 AM, an earthquake occurred in Greece potentially affecting 4590000 people within 100km. The earthquake had Magnitude 7M, Depth:10km.
